body.p: The top section of the screen provides the operator with an overview of the entire batch plant that for monitoring and detection of problems. The image below explains the purpose of each of these buttons.

note.p: The latest incoming message appears at the top of the screen. Recent messages can be viewed using the buttons in the upper left corner, which are identified on the following page. The messages and alarms are explained in detail in SBS-OP-003 Alarm Message System.

fig.title: Understanding the Overview Area on a Typical Screen

body.p: Four key operations have tabs in the Overview area at the top of the screen:
To the right of each operation tab is a 5-segment group display that shows current messages for that operation. (Only three segments are currently used.) The messages include:

ul.li: A=Alarm violation of the alarm limit (white on red)
W=Warning violation of the warning limit (black on yellow)
